Sampah di Samping Rel Citeureup Belum Diangkut, Warga Keluhkan Asap-Lalat
04 Nov 2019, 14:05 by Sachril Agustin Berutu
Jakarta - Tumpukan sampah yang berada di pinggir rel kereta api, RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Kabupaten Bogor, tak kunjung diangkut. Warga mengaku tumpukan sampah tersebut sangat menggangu.
"Asap dan lalatnya sangat mengganggu," kata salah satu warga bernama Zakaria, ketika ditemui di sekitaran lokasi, RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Kabupaten Bogor, Senin (4/11/2019).
Dia menjelaskan, tumpukan sampah ini terkadang dibakar warga untuk mengurangi bau. Namun asap pembakaran itu, kata Zakaria, sangat mengganggunya. Selain itu, banyak lalat yang muncul akibat tumpukan sampah ini. Zakaria mengatakan, lalat-lalat selalu mengerumuni tempatnya setiap hari.
"Dari pagi sampai sore banyak lalat. Kalau lalatnya ke makanan, saya khawatir kena penyakit," tutur dia.


Foto: Sampah di samping rel Citeureup (Sachril/detikcom)

Dia pun mengatakan, pembersihan belum dilakukan. Petugas, kata Zakaria, baru datang untuk melakukan pengecekan saja. Dia pun berharap agar tumpukan sampah di samping rel itu cepat dibersihkan.
"Insyaallah saya dan warga siap membantu kalau diminta untuk ikut mengangkut sampah. Tapi tumpukan sampah ini belum dibersihkan kan. Saya juga enggak tau kapan akan dibersihkan," ucap Zakaria.
Terpantau di lokasi, Senin (4/11/2019), tumpukan sampah di RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Kabupaten Bogor, memanjang sampai sekitar 50 meter. Ketinggiannya, sekitar 2-4 meter.


Foto: Sampah di samping rel Citeureup (Sachril/detikcom)

Terlihat ada banyak sampah yang terbungkus kantong plastik. Selain itu, ditemukan banyak sisa makanan, sisa sayuran, sampah plastik, dan ranting pohon.
Sebagian tumpukan sampah tampak menghitam seperti bekas dibakar. Akibat pembakaran ini, sampah pun terlihat padat. Muncul bau yang cukup menyengat dari sampah ini. Selain itu, juga terlihat banyak lalat hijau di tumpukan sampah ini.

Trash in Side of the Citeureup Railroad Has Not Been Transported, Residents Complain about Smoke-Flies
Nov 04 2019, 14:05 by Sachril Agustin Allied
Jakarta - Piles of garbage located on the edge of the railroad tracks, RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Bogor Regency, have never been transported. Residents claim the pile of garbage is very disturbing.
"The smoke and flies are very disturbing," said one resident named Zakaria, when met at the surrounding location, RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Bogor Regency, Monday (11/04/2019).
He explained, this garbage pile was sometimes burned by residents to reduce odors. But the burning smoke, said Zakaria, was very disturbing. In addition, many flies have arisen from this rubbish heap. Zakaria said, flies were always swarming every day.
"From morning to evening there are a lot of flies. If the flies go to food, I am afraid of getting sick," he said.


Photo: Trash beside the Citeureup rail (Sachril / detikcom)

He also said, cleaning has not been done. Officers, said Zakaria, had just come to check. He also hopes that the pile of garbage beside the rails will be quickly cleaned up.
"God willing, I and the residents are ready to help if asked to take part in transporting rubbish. But this pile of rubbish has not been cleaned, right? I also don't know when it will be cleaned," Zakaria said.
Observed at the location on Monday (11/04/2019), a pile of garbage in RW 7 Puspanegara, Citeureup, Bogor Regency, extends to about 50 meters. Its height is around 2-4 meters.


Photo: Trash beside the Citeureup rail (Sachril / detikcom)

There was a lot of rubbish wrapped in plastic bags. In addition, many leftovers were found, vegetable scraps, plastic waste and tree branches.
Some of the rubbish heap looks black like it was burned. As a result of this burning, the garbage also looks solid. There is a pungent odor from this garbage. In addition, many green flies can also be seen in this rubbish heap.
